justification: "…we recently validated a measure ('controlled reproduction') that can be used to establish whether a given manipulation affects subjective experience, independently from effects of response bias (Sánchez-Fuenzalida et al., 2023)."

"On each trial, participants had to … categorise the target line … and to concurrently provide their confidence on their response (high/low)…"—indicating that confidence was operationalised through explicit confidence ratings.
"…signal detection theoretic (SDT) models that dissociate sensitivity (d') from bias (criterion) in decision making (Green & Swets, 1966)."

measured_by: criterion (c) parameter from Signal Detection Theory
justification: The same SDT sentence notes that bias is captured by the "criterion" parameter, linking response bias to the criterion measure.
"Metacognitive sensitivity is often quantified using meta-d', a measure that computes the type-1 sensitivity (d') one would expect from the observer's metacognitive (type 2) performance."
"…we computed metacognitive efficiency… (meta-d'/d', or M-ratio) reflecting the metacognitive performance of the observer controlling for their type-1 sensitivity."
